Description.val: This line item funds the modifications to the Adversary aircraft.  The Adversary aircraft are a combination of 43 F-5 Tiger IIs (40 F-5Ns and 3 F-5Fs), and Block 15 F-16 Fighting Falcon (10 F-16As and 4 F-16Bs), and the J85 Engine supporting  the F-5F/N.  The Adversary aircraft provide essential sorties in support of TOPGUN, Fleet Replacement Squadron, Carrier Strike Group, Carrier Air Wing and Unit Deployment Plan training  Both the F-5s and the F-16s are planned to be used as primary Adversary mission through 2025.

Justification.val: The FY 2019 funding request is increased by $10.671M to reflect the Department of Navy's effort address requirement changes and accelerate delivery of critical products delivered under OSIP 017-17.

Name.@footnote: (1) FY17 execution year changes were implemented to avoid a production break in FY2018 and included procurement of 1 additional FY2017 kit and 1 additional installation. Install cost increase in FY2018 and FY2019 due to increased  projections in over and above work bases on actual expenditures on the first installation.  (2) The second kit from FY2018 procurement will be installed in the following year to avoid production line break.

ImplementationMethodName.val: Organic Maintenance Facility Hill Air Force Depot:: Installation Name: Falcon UP Kits

Description.val:
This OSIP incorporates the Falcon Up structural enhancement modification in 10 Navy F-16A Adversary aircraft.  The Falcon Up modification is a safety  modification that replaces known airframe fatigue sensitive structure.  Incorporation of the Falcon Up kit extends the airframe service life from 3,665  flight hours to 4,250 flight hours  and will extend the service life until approximately 2025.

Development Status/major milestones:  The structural components on the Falcon Up kit have been qualified by the Air Force and approved for Navy use.  No operational testing is required.  A first article test, consisting of nondestructive critical measurements is complete.  A firm fixed price contract for kits have been awarded.  The kits are in production and delivering on time.  The aircraft modification is done as a heel to toe drive in mod at Hill Air Force Depot and are on-going following the modification schedule.

ModificationTitle.val: F-5 System Safety and Sustainability OSIP 017-17

Title.val: F-5 System Safety and Sustainability OSIP 017-17

Name.@footnote: ARC 210 installation will be by depot level field mod team installation
Forty F-5N aircraft have one display, and three F-5F aircraft have 2 displays each (40 + 6 = 46 units)
SACA is a squadron level install
LN 260 display is a squadron level install

ImplementationMethodName.val: A Kits ARC-210 Radio - Not Installed
[none specified]:: Installation Name: B Kits ARC-210

Description.val:
Funds will be utilized to manage, process and incorporate Engineering Change Proposals (ECPs) and implement changes to sustain and improve F-5  weapons system readiness including safety, mission availability, structural integrity, weapon system employment, and component (avionics/systems) reliability, maintainability, and obsolescence conditions. 

Current planned initiatives include:
- Obsolescence ECPs to the Stability Augmentation Control Assembly (SACA).
- Upgrades to the LN-260 display.
- Air Data Computer
- Support Equipment
- Communication upgrade replacing existing Swiss unique radio with an integrated ARC 210 radio.

Increase of $10.671M in FY2019 provides the following:

1)  Prior budget submit had a reduced scope for the SACA project(redesign of two circuit cards and procurement of those cards). Increasing the scope of the effort needed to resolve reliability issue experience by the fleet.  Project increased to upgrade all circuit cards and procure inventory objective of the new design.

2)  Accelerates the procurement of a new LN 260 display. Prior budget submit had design/qualification NRE over FY2019 & FY2020 and with production procurement in  FY2020 & FY2021 solely due to affordability.  The additional FY2019 funding allows a single contract for the NRE and production of this modified COTS display. The estimates for the NRE and production costs have increased due to better fidelity in the estimate as this display also acts as the bus controller.

3) Accelerates the incorporation of new communication equipment by 12 months. The additional funds start and complete the ARC 210 retrofit one year earlier and provide a better execution profile both for procurement and installation.  Changes to the kit and install cost elements but overall total project cost is a reduction.
